intro: Rubus geniculatus var. laceratus, commonly known as the rough blackberry, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. The botanical features of this species make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
